business.headline: Explained: Why Swiggy share price gained in early trade todaySwiggy's share price jumped over 9% to reach a day high of Rs 542.10, marking a 39% gain over its issue price of Rs 390. At 11:07 am, the stock was trading 3.36% higher at Rs 512 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

UIDAI extends free Aadhaar updates until December 14: All you need to knowUIDAI has extended the free Aadhaar update deadline to December 14, 2024, allowing users to update key details online for free.

Explained: Why ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares fell in early trade today ITC, Godfrey Phillips stocks fell in early trade after a proposed change from the Group of Ministers (GoM) on GST rate rationalisation.

Explained: Why KPIT Technologies share price jumped 6% todayAt 10:28 am, the stock was trading 5.90% higher at Rs 1,420.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, regaining some momentum after a period of underperformance.

Gold, silver price today, December 3, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Wipro shares down 50%? Here's why some apps are showing the wrong priceWipro share price: Wipro stocks appeared down by 50%. However, the decline shown in certain brokerage platforms is not due to a genuine fall in the stock's value.
Sensex, Nifty open flat; ITC share price down 3% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 39.47 points to 80,287.55, while the NSE Nifty50 added 21.05 points to 24,297.10.

Share price of ITC, Godfrey Phillips to be in focus today. Here's why Shares of ITC and Godfrey Phillips, which derive a huge portion of their revenue from the tobacco and cigarette business, are likely to see movement based on investor reactions.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Power, Wipro, Swiggy, Tata Power, CiplaDespite mixed signals, several stocks such as Adani Power, Wipro, Swiggy, Tata Power, Cipla are expected to be in focus today due to key news and developments.

Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger's 'Bittersweet' response after being forced out Intel's Chief Financial Officer, David Zinsner, and Executive Vice President, Michelle Johnston Holthaus, have taken over as interim co-CEOs while the board searches for a permanent replacement.

GST on cigarettes, tobacco, aerated drinks may rise to 35%: ReportGST News: The Group of Ministers (GoM), led by Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Choudhary, met on Monday to finalise the proposed rate adjustments.

Bangladesh halves power buying from Adani citing low winter demand: ReportAdani has been supplying power to Bangladesh under a 25-year contract signed in 2017 under ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, from a $2-billion power plant in Jharkhand that has two units, each with a capacity of about 800 megawatts.
Sensex, Nifty rebound amid cautious optimism ahead of RBI meetThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 445.29 points to close at 80,248.08, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 144.95 points to end at 24,276.05.

Government scraps windfall tax on crude oil, jet fuel, petrol and diesel exportsFirst imposed in July 2022, the windfall tax—formally known as Special Additional Excise Duty (SAED)—was introduced to capitalise on extraordinary profits earned by oil producers and exporters amid surging global crude prices driven by the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

Flight tickets and food deliveries to cost more this holiday season?Get ready for higher costs this holiday season as jet fuel and LPG prices rise, making air travel and dining out more expensive. Here's what you can expect in key cities across India.

Ola Electric share price jumps over 6% after key update from CEOThe update revealed that Ola Electric is set to increase its number of stores from 800 to 4,000 by the end of this month, with all of them scheduled to open on December 20.

Elon Musk takes Sam Altman's OpenAI to court over for-profit transformationElon Musk has sued OpenAI, accusing it of using unfair practices to harm rival companies, including his own AI company, xAI. However, OpenAI has dismissed the claims.

Elon Musk's Starlink could gain as Centre mulls relaxing satcom norms: ReportSatcom licences in India are governed by the Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite (GMPCS) system, which includes 30-40 regulatory conditions.
Cochin Shipyard share price hits 5% upper circuit. Know whyCochin Shipyard shares were trading 5% higher at Rs 1,655.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

Will RBI cut key interest rates on December 6? 3 things to knowExperts suggest that while a rate cut in December seems unlikely, a reduction in the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) could be on the cards to support liquidity in the system.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Delhi-Lucknow fight: Akhilesh Yadav alleges BJP conspiracy in Sambhal violence Live UpdatesAkhilesh Yadav, speaking in Lok Sabha, said the police and the administration were responsible for the Sambhal violence, which left five dead, and demanded a murder case be filed against the officers.

Lawyers threatened, Bangladesh Hindu monk gets no legal aid, to spend month in jailThreatened by Islamists in Bangladesh, no lawyer in Chattogram came to fight for the bail hearing of Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari in jail for over a week in jail now. Das's former lawyer is battling for his life in the ICU after a brutal attack, and the monk will have to be in jail for a month now.

Actor Nargis Fakhri's sister charged with murder in US: 'You're all going to die'Aliya Fakhri is accused of setting a fire in the detached garage of Edward Jacobs' home, killing him and his friend Anastasia Ettienne, after Jacobs reportedly rejected her attempts to reconcile their relationship.

Akali Dal's Sukhbir Badal, on wheelchair, serves punishment at Golden TempleOn August 30, Akal Takht Jathedar, Giani Raghbir Singh, along with four other high priests, had declared Sukhbir Badal a 'tankhaiya' (guilty of religious misconduct).

JD Vance's pic with wife's Indian family goes viral, Internet reactsA family photograph of US Senator JD Vance with his wife Usha Vance's extended Indian family went viral. The picture was supposedly taken on Thanksgiving.

Sheikh Hasina calls Muhammad Yunus mastermind of mass killings in BangladeshSheikh Hasina, addressing an event in New York virtually, slammed Muhammad Yunus for the string of attacks on temples, churches and the religious outfit Iskcon in Bangladesh.
EVs might become more affordable with this move of governmentThe electric car segment is still at a nascent stage in India, with a share of less than 3% in the overall car sales in the country.

Nargis Fakhri not in touch with sister for over 20 years: Source on murder caseActor Nargis Fakhri has not communicated with her sister Aliya Fakhri for over 20 years. Sources said that Nargis hasn't been in touch with her for over 20 years

Elon Musk says DOGE will delete itself. Here's when it will happenThe Department of Government Efficiency, co-led by Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, has set an ambitious expiry date of July 4, 2026, and will "delete itself" when its work is complete.

Eknath Shinde not delaying announcement to name Chief Minister: Shiv SenaMaharashtra BJP chief Chandrashekhar Bawankule had earlier stated that the new chief minister will take oath on December 5 in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Who is Aliya Fakhri, Nargis Fakhri's sister arrested on alleged murder charges?Aliya Fakhri, sister of actor Nargis Fakhri, has been charged with multiple counts of murder and arson. Her troubled past and opioid addiction are believed to have influenced her actions, according to her mother.

Cracks in opposition? Trinamool, Samajwadi Party skip Parliament protestParliament session: While Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi and some Congress allies attended the protest, Akhilesh Yadav and Trinamool leaders were conspicuous by their absence.

Ram Mandir trust releases pics of other shrines being built in temple complexAs per the Trust, the new shrines that are being developed in the Ram Temple premises are the Surya Mandir, Ganesh Mandir, Shiva Mandir, Durga Mandir, Annapurna Mandir and Hanuman Mandir.

Rohit scolds Jaiswal for getting stuck in 'no entry' area en route to AdelaideRohit Sharma scolded Yashasvi Jaiswal after he got stuck in a 'no entry' region. The BCCI shared a fun yet chaotic video of the same.
Is brain fog the digital hangover for Gen Z?Brain fog is becoming a growing concern amongst younger generations, driven by lifestyle, digital overload, and mounting stress.

Tradition or safety? How Kerala government is in a spot over curbs on elephant paradesA political slugfest looms as major temple festivals, of which elephant parades are a major attraction, stare at losing some of their charm

Why Europe chose Isro over Elon Musk's SpaceX to launch Proba-3Categorised as a medium-lift launch vehicle, the PSLV competes with other vehicles like ULA's Atlas V, SpaceX's Falcon 9, Russia's Soyuz 2, China's Long March 4.

Bill Gates faces backlash for calling India a 'laboratory to try things'. Viral videoFormer Microsoft CEO Bill Gates is facing backlash after a video of him describing India as a "kind of laboratory to try things" during a podcast with Reid Hoffman went viral on social media.

Bleeding eye disease: All you need to know about the deadly virusThe Marburg virus, also known as the 'bleeding eye' virus, has claimed 15 lives in Rwanda. This highly infectious pathogen is similar to the Ebola virus and causes bleeding from eyes, nose and mouth.

But District Magistrate Taranjot Singh ordered a probe into the incident that occurred in the BP Mandal Indoor Stadium near his residence.

Cyclone Fengal brings heavy rain, traffic chaos, and school closures to KarnatakaThe India Meteorological Department has issued yellow and orange alerts for various districts in Karnataka. Bengaluru and other parts of Karnataka are likely to experience heavy rain for the next two days.

Gotham Awards 2024: All We Imagine As Light wins Best International FeatureDirector Payal Kapadia's All We Imagine As Light won the Best International Feature at the recently held Gotham Awards. The movie had earlier won the top prize at Cannes Film Festival.

Rishab Shetty to play lead role in The Pride Of Bharat: Chhatrapati Shivaji MaharajKannada star Rishab Shetty is set to play the role of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in Sandeep Singh's upcoming film The Pride Of Bharat: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

BB 18 Day 56: Chahat Pandey fights with Vivian, accuses him of mocking herIn the latest episode of Bigg Boss 18, Vivian Dsena and Chahat Pandey got into an ugly war of words.

sports.headline: Pacer Siddharthh Kaul joins State Bank of India days after retirementSiddarth Kaul transitioned from cricket to banking, joining the State Bank of India days after retiring, marking a new chapter in his life. The former India pacer shared the news with fans through a heartfelt Twitter post.

Urvil Patel follows up fastest T20 hundred with 36-ball century in SMATUrvil Patel followed up his fastest T20 hundred by an Indian with a 36-ball century in the ongoing Sayed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. The Gujarat batter has hit two of the four-fastest T20 hundreds by an Indian within a week.

Australia still confident to win series vs India: Carey ahead of pink ball TestWicketkeeper-batter Alex Carey revealed in the press-conference that the Australian team is still confident of winning the Test series vs India.

Steve Smith cops blow on finger, walks off injured from Adelaide netsBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Australia batter Steve Smith left the Adelaide nets after getting hit on his fingers. Smith copped a clow from Marnus Labuschagne during throwdowns.

Australia not expecting to bowl out India for 36 again: Alex CareyAustralia are not expecting to bowl out India for 36-all-out again, said Alex Carey ahead of the pink ball Test in Adelaide. Australia have a terrific pink ball record at home where they are yet to lose a Test match.

No Salah, Messi-Ronaldo make it to FIFAPRO shortlistLionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo made it to the shortlist of the FIFAPRO team sparking a small furore among the football fans. Many called out the exclusion of Mohamed Salah who is currently enjoying a terrific season at Liverpool.

BBL veteran Peter Siddle signs deal with Melbourne Stars at the age of 40The Melbourne Stars have signed veteran speedster Peter Siddle ahead of the 14th season of the Big Bash League. The franchise will aim to end their title-drought as they are yet to claim the BBL trophy.

Shubman Gill should wait, Dhruv Jurel in Adelaide Playing XI: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh feels that Shubman Gill would have to wait for his chance and urged the team management to stick with Dhruv Jurel for the Adelaide Test. Gill missed the Perth Test win due to an injury.

AUS vs IND: Coach Gautam Gambhir to rejoin Indian team today in AustraliaIndia coach Gautam Gambhir is all set to rejoin the Indian team on Tuesday, December 3 ahead of the pink-ball Test in Adelaide. Gambhir had left for home due to personal reasons after the Perth Test win.

Don't come to India if you don't want to: Harbhajan Singh's stern message to PakHarbhajan Singh said India cannot travel to Pakistan until the situation in the neighbouring country gets better. He also said that the PCB should let the Champions Trophy take place.

ISL: East Bengal raises concern over minority persecution in BangladeshEast Bengal Club has voiced concerns over the safety of minorities in Bangladesh, urging immediate government action. The club's statement aligns with its legacy of supporting marginalised communities.

Rohit Sharma won't bat at 5 or 6, will open or bat at No.3: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh has claimed that Rohit Sharma won't bat at 5 or 6 during the Adelaide Test. The former spinner feels that Rohit will either open the batting or come in at No.3.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
